title: 104_s1458
content:
Section 505(m) and Section 512(o) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act are amended to replace references to the Patent and Trademark Office with "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." Section 702(d) of the same Act is also amended to replace "Commissioner of Patents" with the same entity. Section 501(b)(1) of the Jobs Through Trade Expansion Act of 1994, Section 2 of the Act of August 27, 1935, and Section 105(e) of the Federal Alcohol Administration Act are all amended to replace references to the Patent and Trademark Office with "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." Section 1295(a)(4) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to replace "Patent and Trademark Office" with "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." Section 1744 of title 28 is also amended to update references from "Patent Office" to "United States Patent and Trademark Office" and to change "Commissioner of Patents" to "Commissioner of Patents and Trademarks." Section 1745 of title 28 is similarly amended. Section 1745 of title 28, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the "United States Patent Office" with the "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." Section 1928 of title 28 and section 9101(3) of title 31 are also updated to reflect the change to the "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." Additionally, title 35, United States Code, is amended to replace mentions of the "Patent and Trademark Office" with the "United States Patent and Trademark Office." The text amends the table of sections for chapter 1 of part I of title 35, United States Code, by replacing references to the "United States Patent Office" with the "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." The text amends chapter 1 of title 35, United States Code, by replacing "United States Patent Office" with "United States Patent and Trademark Corporation." The text outlines the establishment, powers, duties, officers, and employees of the United States Patent and Trademark Corporation. It also covers restrictions on officers and employees regarding patents, the Advisory Board, legal suits involving the Corporation, and other related provisions. The Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 and the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 are amended to include the United States Patent and Trademark Corporation. The National Aeronautics and Space Act of 1958 is also amended to reflect this change. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of the United States Code to replace references to the "Commissioner of Patents" with "Commissioner of Patents and Trademarks." This includes changes to the Solar Energy Research, Development, and Demonstration Act of 1974 and sections of title 44. Additionally, sections 1337 and 1338 of title 44 are repealed. Sections 1337 and 1338 of title 44, United States Code, are repealed. Section 10(i) of the Trading with the Enemy Act is amended to replace "Commissioner of Patents" with "Commissioner of Patents and Trademarks." TITLE II--MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

SEC. 201. SEPARABILITY: If any provision of this Act is held invalid, the rest of the Act remains unaffected.

SEC. 202. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act will take effect 180 days after enactment.
